markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Conjuration](/Rules.aspx?ID=263)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 297 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
[Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33) spells transport creatures via teleportation, create an object, or bring a creature or object from somewhere else (typically from another plane) to follow your commands.

 Conjuration spells often have the [teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156) trait, and the creatures summoned by conjuration spells have the [summoned](/Traits.aspx?ID=154) trait.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
name: Conjuration
search_markdown:
<additional-info>
<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 297 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Chapter 7: Spells / Magical Schools
</additional-info>
text: Conjuration Source Core Rulebook pg. 297 4.0 Conjuration spells transport creatures via teleportation, create an object, or bring a creature or object from somewhere else (typically from another plane) to follow your commands. Conjuration spells often have the teleportation trait, and the creatures summoned by conjuration spells have the summoned trait.
